Reviews.Title: “Small, cramped hotel that's already looking dated”
Reviews.Author: svince80
Reviews.Content: On the surface, this hotel looks great; it's in a good location (within a 5 minute walk to all the main sights), it looks 'boutique' and it looks pretty new. However, there are many things wrong with it. First of all, the room is absolutely tiny for the price (I've stayed in other hotels literally around the corner so can compare). Not only is it small, but it's badly designed, so you can't open the wardrobe door without a lot of moving around. The bathroom was the same, and not helped by the fact that the shower leaked so we had to cover the floor in towels. Although the hotel is clearly quite new, there was already mould on the wall of our room. There was also not a lot of variety for breakfast, considering what we paid. There were a lot of minor things that made this hotel less comfortable than others - such as no instructions on how to use the safe and the TV channels all being in Turkish. I would not recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Views”
Reviews.Author: MarkSteffens
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here, excellent location, there was one less-than-friendly receptionist but the other two were super friendly so it made up for his grumpiness. A little noisy with the trains in front but I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what is needed for Istanbul tourists.”
Reviews.Author: Optimizt
Reviews.Content: The hotel is set in a calm street. It overlooks the sea and is a few minutes' walk away from SultanAhmet mosque and the HagiaSophia museum, the grand bazaar and many other historic attractions. For its price I find this hotel very satisfactory because I had free fast Internet wi-fi, flip-flops, reasonably priced mini-bar, satellite tv, a safe, and a laptop at the reception in case I didn't carry my own. Cleaning was done properly too. The staff is very friendly, they all speak English and obviously know all about their city so their advice and suggestions were always a good addition to the brochures they have. So all in all, if you're a casual tourist willing to see Istanbul while staying in a historic spot of the city with 4 star comfort and services, this hotel is a perfect choice. And if you're a businessman/businesswoman aiming for a more "cosmopolitan" place, then you might want to look into other places more to the north of SultanAhmet.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, discreet and good location”
Reviews.Author: Helen L
Reviews.Content: No problems with this very nice hotel. We had a junior suite and it was reasonably spacious with a panoramic view of the sea and a nice bathroom. True, if you looked down instead of out you could see the railway line and the road, but the sound didn't penetrate and this wasn't a factor. The hotel is on a quiet street too. The staff were helpful and will bring tea to your room if you ask. Breakfast is very nice and varied. The tv is LCD but only one English language channel and no dvd so bring a lap top and your own dvds if you want nights in. Sheets changed every afternoon, which is very nice these days. Would definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Just a perfect boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Maria P
Reviews.Content: Bucoleon Palace Hotel is located on nice and quiet street in a old city,in a few minute you are in Ayia sofia,blue Mosque and Top kapi.The staff was very helpfull and friendly,really accomodated all our needs.The breakfast was perfect on the terrace and the view of the marmara's sea is amazing.Just perfect i 'll be there again and the next time!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel Ä±n old city”
Reviews.Author: alberto f
Reviews.Content: l stayed Ä±n thÄ±s hotel one week ago with my girlfriend. we stayed Ä±n the suit room which has gorcious sea view.there is a terrace on the top. we had our breakfast at the top. it was amazing. rich breakfast. we ate delicious homemade foods... everyday housekeping cleaned our room.the staff were friendly and helpful.they were all the time tried to help us and gave good recommendations for tours, restaurants and night shows.thanks a lot to all sttaf... altough we ask many questions to staff they always smÄ±led and helped us. the locatÄ±on Ä±s great; close to all hÄ±ctorÄ±cal places. blue mosque, hypodrom area,sofÄ±a,topkapi palace is close to the hotel..we went to all these places Ä±n a few mÄ±nutes by walk. we had unforgotten memories in this hotel... we would like to stay here again Ä±n our next trip.however we started to plan for staying in this hotel again.absolutely l recommend this amazing hotel to everybody...

Reviews.Title: “Our winter trip to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Jochen M
Reviews.Content: Its a very good place to stay. The owner and the personal is very kind and they try to help you in every aspect. The hotel is small (as we remember 4 double rooms and 3 cosy suites) and therefore very familiar. Its clean, the beds are comfortable. If you are a non smoker, you should make sure to get a room, where no one smoked before. the hotel is very close to teh Blue Mosque and to Topkapi Serail - we would like to come again!

Reviews.Title: “Sehr gut :))) Very nice Palace Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alkan a
Reviews.Content: Gutes Preis LeistungsverhÃ¤ltnis,zentrale Lage...â€œHatte das GlÃ¼ck, die KÃ¶nigsuite zu bekommen, war herrlich.konfortabel, alle Mitarbeiter sehr bemÃ¼ht....mann fÃ¼hlt sich wie eigene zuhause :) herzlichen dank fÃ¼r alles..... Good value for money, central location ... "Had the good fortune to get the royal suite was lovely,konfortabel, all staff worked very hard .... man feels like your own home :) thank you very much for everything

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Gjergji S
Reviews.Content: The hotel exceded our expectations. It has a great location if you are staying for a few days and want to visit Istanbul`s main sights. The rooms have nice views of "Blue" mosque or Marmara`s sea and are clean and comfortable. The breakfast is served in a terrace with a sea view. And last but not least the hotel`s staff is professional and friendly at the same time. All in all, a great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect situation”
Reviews.Author: Eric D
Reviews.Content: A small but comfortable hotel. Perfect location to walk around Istanbul. Great service.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is nice and clean, location is okay.”
Reviews.Author: skye_lee
Reviews.Content: Rooms are kind of small, but in general the hotel rooms are nice and clean. Personally, I feel the location of this hotel is only okay. Yes, it's close to a lot of the attractions, but I personally preferred the Bazaar area more. This area is very touristy, and the hotel is on the side of a steep hill.

Reviews.Title: “cool”
Reviews.Author: Oneders
Reviews.Content: Cool place. fair price. nice clean & pretty rooms, the sea view rooms. thats the charm of the place. overlooking the sea. enjoy their simpleton breakfast at the small cozy terrace with a nice view of the sea. don't look straight down .. into the rail track . .. :) value for money. location walking distance from the S Mosque n the heart of Istanbul. :) definitely reccommended.

Reviews.Title: “Location and staff set this hotel apart”
Reviews.Author: xeebsta
Reviews.Content: What sets this hotel apart is the amazing service from the staff. They explained things, showed me where they were, called cabs when I was running late, and when that wasn't going to be fast enough to get me where I was going, actually drove me themselves. Can't ask for better than that. I stayed on a room on the opposite side to the train - the room near reception was quite noisy but the next night I moved up a couple of floors and it was fine. The rooms are quite small but are perfect for one person. This will be my first choice for accommodation when I'm back in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and friendly”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: This is about as good as a boutique hotel can get. Very clean and comfortable and excellent Turkish breakfast. The only downside is that this is on the metro line and close to Kennedy Cad which is the main drag that hugs the Sea of Marmara. This gives exceptional views from your lovely room but it's pretty noisy if you like the window open for those sea breezes. Travelling their in the winter you wouldn't open the window anyway. I would recommend this place though.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay at the bucoleon palace hotel”
Reviews.Author: camille b
Reviews.Content: We came from France to Istanbul and we stayed a week at the bucoleon palace. The hotel is well located, in the heart of the old Istanbul, in a quiet street at 5 min from the blue mosque and all facilities. The staff is very friendly, helpful and we were super well welcomed my friend and I. Rooms are clean, breakfast is good and there is always something new and fresh everyday! It s not so far from the airport, we took the subway and then the train, in 1 hour, were in downtown and we found easily the hotel ( map is necessary of course). I will come back and advice it, for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional accommodation”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadToronto
Reviews.Content: I have travelled extensively and it takes a very special place to capture my attention and write a review. Location is 5 minute walk to Hagia Sophia, Topkapi and Blue Mosque. Room ---there is always that moment when you unlock the door to a new accomodation. I smiled from ear to ear. It was beautifully appointed, spotless and had a balcony overlooking the sea. A full and tastey breakfast was included. It is great $ value. Management couldn't do enough for me. Get this. I asked for directions and from the look on my face the desk manager knew I wasn't following. He had a fellow take me!!! Do something terrific for yourself stay here.

Reviews.Title: “My "home" in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: kimHansen1101
Reviews.Content: Nice small boutique hotel, in the old town, walking distance to Grand Bazaar, The beautiful Mosques etc, which is important in hectic and traffic jammed Istanbul. The view from the hotel facing Bosporus is amazing. Use the hotel for business, bit I also brought my wife and 2 kid's 11 and 14 yrs old. It is just GREAT. Kim

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel we have ever had the misfortune to stay at!”
Reviews.Author: Roburquhart
Reviews.Content: Our room was directly off the main lobby with the reception area, the stairs and lift right on our doorstep. We could hear every conversation and all the guests coming and going. Our room overlooked the major rail line which is very busy until very late! Most of the trains blow their whistle as they rush past. The trains were only 2 metres from our balcony doorway. The top of the hotel perimeter fence was covered in enormous rolls of razor wire. It felt as though we were in a prison. Beyond the razor wire and the rail line is a major freeway that carries incredibly heavy traffic 24 hours a day. Impatient drivers toot their horns and the noise of the traffic is unrelenting. T The room was clean but very depressing and incredibly noisy. The final straw came when we wanted to go to bed and there was only one sheet covering our matress. There was no other bedding. We asked reception and we were informed that there were no sheets available. We were stunned! The reception staff said the bedding was being cleaned and then they found 2 single bed light weight covers and we were forced to make do with these for the night. It was appallingly uncomfortable. We stayed one night and couldn't get out fast enough. We quickly found another hotel which was awesome! We have travelled the world and stayed in hundreds of different accommodations but the Bucolean wins the prize for the WORST HOTEL we have ever encountered

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, clean, cozy excellent for tourists.”
Reviews.Author: Heeda
Reviews.Content: I was on business trip but since the hotel was so close to the historical areas I managed to fit in a quick tour of the the old city as well. if you are looking for something cozy and clean to make you feel comfortable with friendly staff this is the place to be. its very close to everywhere you want to be but same time it has the quiet comfortable feel for relaxing too. There are lots cafes and resturants within walking distance. The terrace view is amazing and I had the view on the blue mousque too in my room. The neigbhourhood is not noisy but the train passes on the sea side which was not much of a problem for me. The breakfast was light and for a small hotel is reasonable but you can always try breakfast in cafes round there if you want more local feel of the place. the rooms are small but thats the way buildings are in the old city but even if they are small they feel very airy and bright and they are new and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “SMALL NEIGHBORHOOD HOTEL, CHARMING STAFF, CLEAN ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: fatih2011
Reviews.Content: Small neighborhood hotel,homey feel, very charming (slightly forgetful) staff, very clean modern rooms. Nice Sultanahmet Camii view. Breakfast covered terrace with great Marmara sea view. Small uphill walk to Hippodrome. Area scattered with shops and restaurants. Would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Frendly, Clear and excellent Service. You have all that you need”
Reviews.Author: ferhatberlin
Reviews.Content: we stayed for three days and could stay for two weeks if we where able to. The service and clearness of this hotel is Excellent. Breakfast was very good. You get Breakfast with a view of the sea. Thanks for your service...... Greatings from Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Baarffan
Reviews.Content: We had a stupendous stay at the hotel . The staff were very helpful friendly and the best of all made us feel welcomed!. Hotel is spotless new furnishings . The view from the rooftop terrace is magnificent. Overall its was a pleasant stay .

Reviews.Title: “gracious hospitality and nice accomadations”
Reviews.Author: Berrylane1
Reviews.Content: This was a good choice for a start in Istanbul. The staff was welcoming and very helpful. The daily breakfast buffet on the rooftop dining area was a real bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Bastos11
Reviews.Content: I and my husband spent several days in this lovely hotel. The hotel room is recently remodelated and very clean. Our room balcony showed the blue mosque minaretes, beautiful! The location is super: we went by foot in every single attraction in the Sulthanamed neighborhood and there are several good tipic restaurants in the vicinity. The staff is very friendly and helped us with our many requests. We had a great time and we strongly reccomend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service at the Bucoleon Palace Hotel”
Reviews.Author: capricorn3112
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent a week in Istanbul and stayed at The Bucoleon. We enjoyed everything about it. The location was fantastic - everything within walking distance or tram.The staff were most helpful, efficient and friendly. When we arrived home in Australia I found that I had left some jewellery in the safe. I contacted the hotel and they organised an international courier to have the package sent to me. This was an incredible help to me and very much appreciated. We would love to spend more time in Turkey and would certainly recommend the Bucolean!

Reviews.Title: “What a great little find!”
Reviews.Author: eyeterri
Reviews.Content: What a great little find this hotel is - fantastic location just a few minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. The service was excellent - there was a problem with my airport pickup and the manager promptly rectified the situation. The high rating is due to the location, comfortable room, friendly service,and excellent hi-fi connection. For me, the whole package was good value. I will note that my room was small - the bed took up most of it. As a solo traveller, that was fine for me (and the bed is comfortable, as noted by others). The breakfast is pretty basic (cereal, dried fruit, yogurt, cheese, tomatoes etc.) but plentiful. There is a cafe right next door for excellent Turkish food (stuffed grape leaves, pita dips and other delicious things). I was also worried as I am a light sleeper and some reviewers mentioned noise. I did hear a little rumble of a train, but even for me it was not at all loud. I need to go back to Istanbul in a few weeks and will stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in the Old Town”
Reviews.Author: javadh
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be very clean, quiet and with very friendly staff. I highly recommend this hotel to those who want to stay at the Old Town.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely respite in Old Istanbul"”
Reviews.Author: scubayogachica
Reviews.Content: Tucked in a little back street near the Blue Mosque, The Bucoleon Palace is small an intimate hotel. The Manager is very helpful and accommodating. There was a mishap regarding the airport pick up service I had requested. The manager/owner? quickly fixed the faux pas by upgrading our room to the garden suite. The only downfall of the Bucoleon Palace is the Train/metro line that is directly behind it. The noise form our room was a bit loud at times and falling asleep without earplugs would be difficult for light sleepers.

Reviews.Title: “Bucoleon Palace Hotel - great choice!”
Reviews.Author: GDICAPRIO
Reviews.Content: We wanted something that felt Turkish and not one of the huge Hotels that just happend to be in Istanbul. This was a geat choice! The Bucoleon Palace Hotel is located on a nice and quiet pedestrian street just a couple of minutes walk from Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern, etc. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The friendly staff gave us good reccomendations and were very happy and helpful to arrange for reservations. And what a great hospitality! We stayed for 5 days and just wished to be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel, staff friendly and helpful, great position”
Reviews.Author: SusannaP557
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this little hotel, in a great location, five minutes walk from all the sights in this part of amazing Istanbul.The staff were more than helpful and the delicious breakfast on terrace was perfect .Returning in the evening was like coming home! Could not recommend it more highly. It is only small with a small foyer so do not book if you want five star marble wall to wall but it wins on atmosphere every time. Spotless and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Tracie031
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel with local flavor, then Bucoleon Palace Hotel is the place for you! The hotel is located within the windy streets of Old Istanbul and is in close walking distance to all the sights and the main town square. The hotel staff is great, and really accommodated all of our needs. They told us that the Bucoleon Palace was our home away form home, and we sure felt like that! Breakfast is delicious with amazing views of the sea, the free internet was fast, the rooms were quiet and clean, and the location could not be beat. One suggestion-- the rooms do not have clocks so be sure to bring your own alarm if you need to be up in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent value boutique hotel, I will definitely stay again on my next visit”
Reviews.Author: EuroMattNZ
Reviews.Content: Excellent value with friendly staff and overall a very enjoyable experience. Not quite as seemless as staying in a 5-star hotel. Staff understood basic English but had limited knowledge of the tourist attractions. Rooms are very nice, if a bit small. I would be surprised if there is better value boutique accomodation in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with nice staff”
Reviews.Author: abdooooo
Reviews.Content: I had a very bad experience in my first day in Istanbul with a hotel called (Vicapalas hotel) it is very bad hotel like a person with very bad staff (refused to give me a receipt and asked me to pay for 6 nights if i will leave the hotel in after the first night). I decided to stay on this hotel for night and moved to Bucoleon Palace Hotel. it is very nice hotel with helpful staff. the wireless connection is excellent and quite room with air conditioning and good view to sultanahmet old city. they have a great roof with a nice view to the marmara sea. I do recommend this hotel for any of you. Trust me :)

Reviews.Title: “delightful”
Reviews.Author: NYCityNY
Reviews.Content: The Bucolean Palace is a small 4 story bed & breakfast with all the modern amenities we wanted.we stayed there for 4 nights in a very large comfortable room with a little balcony. The L-shaped room provided us with a sitting area as well as a bed. the sitting area was a nice place to watch tv or read or gaze at the beautiful ocean view. It was hot in August, and the airconditioning worked wonderfully. Housekeeping was immaculate. Location was great, very close to the major sites. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go. Sunny the manager was wonderful to us. He was friendly, helpful and cared very much about our comfort. Every morning we enjoyed breakfast on the roof with a view of the sea. For full disclosure, I want to mention that a hiway and train track was nearby which at first concerned us, but the windows were so soundproof we did not hear any traffic. We heard the train whistle a couple of times, but it was not a problem. The shower was a bit small, but everything else in the room was very comfortable.The street that the hotel was on was typical old city, which means a mix of buildings that were well cared for and others that had seen better days. All in all, I recommend this charming hotel very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel ever....”
Reviews.Author: Ishtar11
Reviews.Content: We went again to Bucoleon Palace, and what can we say...each time our stay is absolutely perfect. The manager is so kind, the staff is friendly, always helping. The rooms are very well designed, clean, as the bathroom. No noise disturbing during the nights.... There also is an enjoyable terrasse with a seaview. Breakfast perfect....we really feel at home there and will book a room again as soon as possible. 5 stars hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The location and services are the best in the area”
Reviews.Author: rapcencu
Reviews.Content: We stood in this hotel for 8 days and we were very impressed. We didn'd expected so much ospitality and good conditions. It is so clean and there are rooms with view to the Blue Moskey. They have a terase where tou can take breakfast with a splendid view to Marmara sea. When i will go again in Istanbul i will definitely reserve a room at the same hotel. Aftyer only one night you will love this place. It is full with positive energy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, location and views”
Reviews.Author: PPedro_10
Reviews.Content: This nice and well located hotel has excellent views to The Blue Mosque and to the Marmara Sea (breakfast is served in a roof terrace with unforgettable views). For informations about the city or whatever you need ask Sircan, one of the nice receptionists! Pedro e LÃ­dia, Portugal

Reviews.Title: “Very nice location, good facilities”
Reviews.Author: Jayarama
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near the Small Aya Sofya, in a quiet area that is 10 minutes walk to the Hippodrome, the centre of the city, that is much more crowded and noisy. The staff is very helpful and tidy, they were always ready to help us but never too close to make us uncomfortable. The manager was very nice and honest. Having seen other hotels in Istanbul, this is probably a very nice budget option both for business and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to visit old Istanbul. Truly welcoming & committed personnel”
Reviews.Author: SuperMMF
Reviews.Content: Cozy suites in a recently renovated town house. Bathroom was spacious and very clean and the bed was particularly comfortable. The suites come with a small private terrasse on the Marmara Sea side, for which the only drawback is to be also nearby the busy commuter train railroad. The noise was however manageable with the terrasse doors closed. The manager and personnel that we dealt with were all outstandingly attentive to our very needs. Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with excellent staff and conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: archaeologytraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the top floor, which I highly suggest because of the excellent views. The room was clean, modern with an antique touch, and had an amazing view of the Sultanahmet Mosque (street-side of the hotel). Even though there was no balcony, the top floor dining balcony was rarely used after breakfast and I could walk out my door and enjoy the view of the sea anytime, so I really enjoyed both views! Comfortable bed and plush towels but no wash cloths so bring your own (this must be a European thing as I've noticed the lack of washcloths at other hotels). The slippers were a plus. Great breakfast selection, something for everyone. The location was excellent for convenience to the main tourist sites: a very short and scenic walk to Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, the Palace Mosaic Museum and the Topkapi Palace as well as shopping. The hotel is located off of the main driving street and away from the noise of large tourist crowds so it was very quiet for sleeping. There is a tramway line on the sea-side of the hotel which I faintly heard but only occasionally so the sound did not bother me as the room seemed well insulated from noise. The staff were exceptional, always ready to answer questions about the neighborhood and tourist sites, make recommendations for restaurants, or set up tickets for excursions, in my case dance tickets at the cultural center. I highly suggest the Doy Doy restaurant as well, just a 2 minute walk to inexpensive, fresh Turkish dishes. Several times they went out of their way to make my stay most enjoyable. I will definitely stay again when I return to Istanbul.

HotelInfo.Name: Bucoleon Palace Hotel
